record.text: Grokにお絵かきしてもらって遊んでるんだけど、特にこれといった指定はしていないのにセンシティブ判定されちゃいそうな動画ができちゃうのはイーロンの趣味なの？特にスカート回りの規制がゆるい気がする。それはさておき、これはセンシティブではない動画（アカBANされたくないので）。このレベルが無料でサクッとできちゃうのはすごい。
(続き)でもまあ、伊25搭載機での米本土空襲で西海岸はパニクったらしいし、灯火管制してもおかしくはないのかも。

小尾信弥翻訳の「星から宇宙へ」をパラパラと読んでいる。Scientific American掲載記事の編集本。原書は1955年発行で、パロマー天文台の200インチ望遠鏡の観測成果がいろいろ上がってきていた時代。アンドロメダはまだ「大星雲」と呼ばれていた。今日はジョージ・W・グレイの「宇宙の大きさと年齢」を読んだ。中身も数字も情報も今となっては古いけど、天文学の歴史として面白い。宇宙の年齢は35億年程度だけどそれは地球の岩石年齢より短い、とかね。本筋ではないけど、ウィルソン山天文台は第二次大戦の灯火管制で空が暗く良い観測結果が得られたってあって、アメリカ本土でも灯火管制してたんだ、と思ったり。
“I asked Grok why Tron: Ares wasn’t successful.” - Disney Exec

Honestly, Grok sponsoring a Tron movie is the most anti-Tron thing and just shows how much Ares is straight up corporate tech bro propaganda. It’s very sad. Tron has such potential and never fully gets there. Legacy and Uprising are good but Tron: Identity tbh is the franchise peak.

This is such a clever idea on taking kids to museums/galleries
www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle...

images.alt:
Nadia from London has an idea that sounds such fun you'll be booking a day out asap.
"I've always loved museums," she says,
"but they can be overwhelming for children. For decades now, I've done something called 'playing postcards'
We do
the museum backwards, visiting the gift shop first. Each child gets to choose three postcards. Then they take it in turns to find that particular artwork in the museum and give us a little information about the piece from the details on the postcard, or from any gallery plaque. At the end of this treasure-hunt-style activity, we vote for our favourite in the cafe."

images.alt: A photoshopped image of four aliens from Doctor Who - in the foreground, is an Ice Lord. a reptilian alien with a domed helmet, shoulder/chest armour and cape. Behind him, to his left is an Ice Warrior, also reptilian, but more bulky and armoured. To the right, is Alpha Centauri, a monocular alien with a large egg-shaped head, and six pincered arms. At the back is Aggedor, a hairy bear-like creature, with a large snout, sharp teeth and claws and a single horn on it's forehead. They are positioned in a primitive, but elegant throne room with ornate drapes.

images.alt:
In the video Smith posted online, he said Neuralink engineers had started using language models including ChatGPT and Grok to serve up a selection of relevant replies to questions, as well as options for things he could say in conversations going on around him. One example that he outlined: “My friend asked me for ideas for his girlfriend who loves horses. I chose the option that told him in my voice to get her a bouquet of carrots. What a creative and funny idea.” 

These aren’t really his thoughts, but they will do—since brain-clicking once in a menu of choices is much faster than typing out a complete answer, which can take minutes.

### Origins and Early History

Shepherd's Bush, a vibrant suburb in West London's Hammersmith and Fulham borough, derives its name from the area's rural past.

external.description: Origins and Early History  Shepherd's Bush, a vibrant suburb in West London's Hammersmith and Fulham borough, derives its name from the area's rural past. The name likely stems from the common land now known as Shepherd's Bush Green, which served as a resting spot for shepherds driving their flocks to Smithfield Market in the City of London. An old tradition involved pruning a hawthorn bush to create shelter from the elements. Early maps, such as John Rocque's detailed surveys from 1737–1762, first prominently feature "Shepherd's Bush," while Thomas Faulkner's 19th-century histories describe it as sparsely populated farmland with scattered buildings along roads like Uxbridge Road and Goldhawk Road. By 1841, it remained largely undeveloped and rural, dotted with ponds and open fields, contrasting with the rapid growth in nearby Hammersmith.  19th-Century Development and Urbanization  The area transformed dramatically in the mid-to-late 19th century due to London's population boom and railway expansion. Semi-detached houses began appearing around Shepherd's Bush Green by the 1830s, but major residential growth accelerated after 1864 with the opening of a station on the Hammersmith & City Railway. This spurred a "building frenzy," filling the landscape with Victorian terraces and increasing the population exponentially. By the 1880s, Shepherd's Bush had evolved from pastureland into a bustling suburb, with early markets emerging—traders operated informally since the 19th century, laying the groundwork for what became Shepherd's Bush Market in 1914, London's oldest street market, built on former railway land.  Early 20th Century: Exhibitions, Entertainment, and Transport  The 20th century brought global prominence to Shepherd's Bush through major events and infrastructure. In 1908, the Franco-British Exhibition and the Summer Olympics were held at the nearby White City site, drawing over 8 million visitors and hosting football matches that cemented the area's sporting legacy. The Central London Railway (now the Central line) reached Shepherd's Bush in 1900, with its station opening as the line's western terminus—a pioneering "tuppenny tube" linking western suburbs to the City. Entertainment flourished too: The Shepherd's Bush Empire, designed by architect Frank Matcham and opened in 1903 as a music hall, hosted early stars like Charlie Chaplin and later became a BBC Television Theatre in 1953, broadcasting shows such as Juke Box Jury and The Old Grey Whistle Test. Lime Grove Studios followed in 1910, becoming a hub for film and TV production.  Mid-20th Century: Wars, Decline, and Post-War Changes  Shepherd's Bush endured the World Wars with resilience. During World War II, the Empire narrowly escaped a V-1 flying bomb that destroyed the neighboring Shepherd's Bush Pavilion in 1944. Post-war, the area faced slum clearance and urban decay by the 1930s–1950s, leading to council-led redevelopment with high-rise flats. The 1960s–1970s brought disruptive infrastructure: The Westway and M41 spur (now the West Cross Route) severed connections to Holland Park, demolishing Victorian housing and isolating parts of the neighborhood. This era also saw cultural shifts, including the 1977 declaration of the "Free and Independent Republic of Frestonia" by squatters on Freston Road (formerly part of Latimer Road), a short-lived micronation protesting evictions.  Late 20th Century to Present: Regeneration and Modern Vibrancy  From the 1980s onward, Shepherd's Bush rebounded as a multicultural hub, attracting diverse communities reflected in its markets offering African fabrics, Middle Eastern spices, and Caribbean goods. The Bush Theatre, founded in 1972, became a global champion for new plays and playwrights. A major milestone came in 2008 with the opening of Westfield London, Europe's largest shopping center at the time (150,000 m²), built on the former White City exhibition grounds and boosting local economy. Regeneration efforts continue, including a 2011 conservation area to protect historic buildings and debates over market redevelopment. Today, Shepherd's Bush blends independent shops on Uxbridge and Goldhawk Roads with modern amenities, excellent transport (five Tube stations, 18 bus routes), and cultural icons like the O2 Shepherd's Bush Empire, which has hosted legends from David Bowie to Adele. It's a lively, affordable alternative to pricier neighbors like Notting Hill, known for its parks, pubs, and resilient community spirit.
external.title: History of Shepard's Bush London

データベースに存在しないデータは表示できないのは誰でも分かることですが生成AIの場合、データベースに相当するものが学習モデルとなります。
生成AIは未知のものを作り出しているのではなく学習したものを元に生成しているだけです。したがって、学習したデータそのものが残っている限りいくらNG設定で検索ワードを制限しても類似作品を生成します。だから、NG設定はオプトアウトにはならないのです。

オプトイン、オプトアウトという用語の意味は本来は人によって変わるものではなくサム・アルトマン氏がオプトアウトの意味を勝手に変えたことに問題があります。
例えばデータベースに名前と電話番号を入力してLLMで外部から検索可能なシステムを構築した場合、サム・アルトマンの電話番号を許可をとって登録したらオプトイン、とりあえず登録しておいて要請によってデータベースから削除すればオプトアウトとなります。非常にシンプルですね。
今回問題なのはデータベースから削除せず、「サム・アルトマンの電話番号」では検索できないものの「OpenAIのCEOの電話番号」では検索可能な状態を「オプトアウト」と呼んだことです。

記事の要約: チエルコミュニケーションブリッジ株式会社は、2025年10月4日・5日に東京科学大学で開催された第63回日本医療・病院管理学会学術総会において、研修管理システム「GLEXA」を展示しました。この学会では、医療データの活用をテーマに多くの専門家が参加し、活発な議論が行われました。

展示ブースでは、GLEXAの基本機能や導入事例を紹介し、特に近畿大学病院での導入による年間300時間以上の事務工数削減の成果が注目されました。来場者からは、職員教育の効率化や院内研修の質向上に対する前向きな意見が寄せられました。

今後、チエルCBはGLEXAの機能強化とサービス拡充を進め、現場からの…

record.text: 記事の要約: ビバリーグレンラボラトリーズ株式会社は、浸透技術「QuSome®」に関する最新の研究成果を発表しました。この技術は、再生医療分野で注目されるDDS（ドラッグデリバリーシステム）を応用したもので、皮膚のバリア機能に関与するフィラグリンやロリクリン、水分保持機能に関与するアクアポリン3の発現を促進することが確認されました。これにより、QuSome®は従来の浸透促進技術に加え、皮膚機能の直接改善にも寄与する可能性が示され、スキンケア分野でのさらなる応用が期待されています。

record.text: Paper2Video: Automatic Video Generation from Scientific Papers https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.05096 (https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=45553701)

external.description: Academic presentation videos have become an essential medium for research communication, yet producing them remains highly labor-intensive, often requiring hours of slide design, recording, and editing for a short 2 to 10 minutes video. Unlike natural video, presentation video generation involves distinctive challenges: inputs from research papers, dense multi-modal information (text, figures, tables), and the need to coordinate multiple aligned channels such as slides, subtitles, speech, and human talker. To address these challenges, we introduce Paper2Video, the first benchmark of 101 research papers paired with author-created presentation videos, slides, and speaker metadata. We further design four tailored evaluation metrics--Meta Similarity, PresentArena, PresentQuiz, and IP Memory--to measure how videos convey the paper's information to the audience. Building on this foundation, we propose PaperTalker, the first multi-agent framework for academic presentation video generation. It integrates slide generation with effective layout refinement by a novel effective tree search visual choice, cursor grounding, subtitling, speech synthesis, and talking-head rendering, while parallelizing slide-wise generation for efficiency. Experiments on Paper2Video demonstrate that the presentation videos produced by our approach are more faithful and informative than existing baselines, establishing a practical step toward automated and ready-to-use academic video generation. Our dataset, agent, and code are available at https://github.com/showlab/Paper2Video.
external.title: Paper2Video: Automatic Video Generation from Scientific Papers

external.description: Academic presentation videos have become an essential medium for research communication, yet producing them remains highly labor-intensive, often requiring hours of slide design, recording, and editing for a short 2 to 10 minutes video. Unlike natural video, presentation video generation involves distinctive challenges: inputs from research papers, dense multi-modal information (text, figures, tables), and the need to coordinate multiple aligned channels such as slides, subtitles, speech, and human talker. To address these challenges, we introduce Paper2Video, the first benchmark of 101 research papers paired with author-created presentation videos, slides, and speaker metadata. We further design four tailored evaluation metrics--Meta Similarity, PresentArena, PresentQuiz, and IP Memory--to measure how videos convey the paper's information to the audience. Building on this foundation, we propose PaperTalker, the first multi-agent framework for academic presentation video generation. It integrates slide generation with effective layout refinement by a novel effective tree search visual choice, cursor grounding, subtitling, speech synthesis, and talking-head rendering, while parallelizing slide-wise generation for efficiency. Experiments on Paper2Video demonstrate that the presentation videos produced by our approach are more faithful and informative than existing baselines, establishing a practical step toward automated and ready-to-use academic video generation. Our dataset, agent, and code are available at https://github.com/showlab/Paper2Video.

Posdata: He adaptado cositas que me ha puesto la #IA como quitar que los centros de interés de mi hijos tienen que ser dinosaurios o trenes y es que las #IA están entrenadas por humanos que les aportan sus propios sesgos.

- Puedes usarla para aprender más sobre lo que te encanta: … ¡lo que tú quieras!
- Si te sientes raro o confundido, es mejor hablar con mamá, papá o alguien de confianza.

Recuerda: tú eres el jefe de la conversación. La IA está aquí para ayudarte, no para mandarte.

Con cariño, Mamá.

Por eso, aquí tienes algunas ideas para que la uses bien:

- Tú decides qué quieres saber. Puedes pedirle que te explique sin darte órdenes.
- Si te habla raro o te dice algo que no te gusta, puedes decirle: “No quiero consejos.”

【ふるさと納税】和歌山県 日高町 応援寄附 1口 1000円 【返礼品なし】 和歌山県日高町を応援しませんか？ 日高町へのふるさと納税、返礼品なしの寄附という形で、地域を支えることができるんです。 1000円から気軽にできるので、ぜひ最後まで読んでみてください。 日高町は、和歌山県の美しい海岸線に面した、自然豊かな町です。 温暖な気候と豊かな自然に恵まれ、農業や漁業が盛んな地域として知られています。…

external.description: 【ふるさと納税】和歌山県 日高町 応援寄附 1口 1000円 【返礼品なし】 和歌山県日高町を応援しませんか？ 日高町へのふるさと納税、返礼品なしの寄附という形で、地域を支えることができるんです。 1000円から気軽にできるので、ぜひ最後まで読んでみてください。 日高町は、和歌山県の美しい海岸線に面した、自然豊かな町です。 温暖な気候と豊かな自然に恵まれ、農業や漁業が盛んな地域として知られています。 しかし、近年では人口減少や高齢化が進み、地域経済の活性化が課題となっています。 そこで注目されているのが、ふるさと納税制度を活用した地域への支援です。 日高町では、返礼品なしの寄附を受け付けています。 返礼品にかかる費用を削減し、その分を地域の課題解決に役立てるという取り組みです。 寄附金は、主に以下のような事業に使われます。 * 子育て支援事業：保育所の充実や、子育てに関する相談窓口の設置など * 高齢者福祉事業：高齢者の健康増進や、介護サービスの充実など * 地域活性化事業：観光振興や、地域産業の育成など * 教育事業：学校施設の整備や、教育プログラムの充実など * 防災対策事業：災害に強い町づくり、防災意識の向上 皆様からの温かいご支援は、日高町の未来を創る力となります。 「ふるさと納税って、手続きが難しそう…」 そう思われる方もいらっしゃるかもしれません。 でも、ご安心ください。 ふるさと納税の手続きは、意外と簡単なんです。 以下のステップで、簡単に寄附できます。 1. 寄附先の自治体を選ぶ（今回は和歌山県日高町です！） 2. 寄附金額を決める（1000円から可能です！） 3. 支払い方法を選ぶ（クレジットカード、銀行振込など） 4. 確定申告をする（ワンストップ特例制度を利用すれば、確定申告は不要です） 楽天ふるさと納税なら、楽天ポイントも貯まってお得です。 [アフィリエイトリンクを挿入] 「返礼品がないのは、ちょっと寂しいな…」 そう感じる方もいらっしゃるかもしれません。 確かに、豪華な返礼品は魅力的ですよね。 でも、返礼品なしの寄附には、それ以上の価値があるんです。 それは、あなたの寄附が、直接的に日高町を支える力になるということです。 返礼品にかかる費用を削減することで、より多くの資金を地域の課題解決に充てることができます。 あなたの温かい気持ちが、日高町の人々の笑顔につながるんです。 返礼品はありませんが、日高町から感謝の気持ちを込めて、お礼状をお送りいたします。 日高町の美しい風景や、地域の人々の温かさに触れていただければ幸いです。 日高町へのふるさと納税は、単なる寄附ではありません。 それは、地域を応援する気持ちの表れであり、未来への投資です。 1000円からできる小さな支援が、大きな力となります。 ぜひ、あなたも日高町を応援してみませんか？ [アフィリエイトリンクを挿入] 最後に、日高町への応援寄附に関するよくある質問をまとめました。 * 寄附金額はいくらからできますか？ * 1口1000円から可能です。 * 支払い方法は何がありますか？ * クレジットカード、銀行振込など、各種お支払い方法をご利用いただけます。 * 確定申告は必要ですか？ * ワンストップ特例制度をご利用いただければ、確定申告は不要です。 * 寄附金の使い道は指定できますか？ * 申し訳ございませんが、寄附金の使い道は指定できません。 * 領収書は発行されますか？ * はい、領収書を発行いたします。 その他、ご不明な点がございましたら、お気軽にお問い合わせください。 皆様からの温かいご支援を、心よりお待ちしております。 [アフィリエイトリンクを挿入] 【ふるさと納税】和歌山県 日高町 応援寄附 1口 1000円 【返礼品なし】

record.text: Zero-click Exploit AI Flaws to Hack Systems #AI #Cloud #Data

external.description:
What if machines, not humans, become the centre of cyber-warfare? Imagine if your device could be hijacked without you opening any link, downloading a file, or knowing the hack happened? This is a real threat called zero-click attacks, a covert and dangerous type of cyber attack that abuses software bugs to hack systems without user interaction. 



The threat



These attacks have used spywares such as Pegasus and AI-driven EchoLeak, and shown their power to attack millions of systems, compromise critical devices, and steal sensitive information. With the surge of AI agents, the risk is high now. The AI-driven streamlining of work and risen productivity has become a lucrative target for exploitation, increasing the scale and attack tactics of breaches.

IBM technology explained how the combination of AI systems and zero-click flaws has reshaped the cybersecurity landscape. “Cybercriminals are increasingly adopting stealthy tactics and prioritizing data theft over encryption and exploiting identities at scale. A surge in phishing emails delivering infostealer malware and credential phishing is fueling this trend—and may be attributed to attackers leveraging AI to scale distribution,” said the IBM report.

A few risks of autonomous AI are highlighted, such as:



 * Threat of prompt injection 
 * Need for an AI firewall
 * Gaps in addressing the challenges due to AI-driven tech






About Zero-click attacks



These attacks do not need user interaction, unlike traditional cyberattacks that relied on social engineering campaigns or phishing attacks. Zero-click attacks exploit flaws in communication or software protocols to gain unauthorized entry into systems.  

Echoleak: An AI-based attack that modifies AI systems to hack sensitive information.

Stagefright: A flaw in Android devices that allows hackers to install malicious code via multimedia messages (MMS), hacking millions of devices.

Pegasus: A spyware that hacks devices through apps such as iMessage and WhatsApp, it conducts surveillance, can gain unauthorized access to sensitive data, and facilitate data theft as well.

How to stay safe?



According to IBM, “Despite the magnitude of these challenges, we found that most organizations still don’t have a cyber crisis plan or playbooks for scenarios that require swift responses.” To stay safe, IBM suggests “quick, decisive action to counteract the faster pace with which threat actors, increasingly aided by AI, conduct attacks, exfiltrate data, and exploit vulnerabilities.”
external.title: Zero-click Exploit AI Flaws to Hack Systems

record.text: Google Launches Gemini AI Across Home and Nest Devices #GeminiAI #GoogleHome #NestDevices

external.description:
Google has unveiled its new Gemini-powered smart home lineup and AI strategy, positioning its AI assistant Gemini at the core of refreshed Google Home and Nest devices. This reimagined approach follows Amazon's recent Echo launch, highlighting an intensifying competition in the AI-driven home sector. 
Google’s aim is to extend Gemini’s capabilities beyond just its own hardware, making it available to other device manufacturers, reminiscent of how Android’s open platform fostered an expansive device ecosystem. The company plans to keep innovating with flagship hardware, particularly where Gemini’s potential can shine, while encouraging third-party OEMs and partners to integrate Gemini regardless of price point or form factor.
The new Nest lineup features products like the Nest Cam Outdoor, Nest Cam Indoor, and Nest Doorbell—all updated to leverage Gemini’s intelligence. Additionally, Google teased its next-generation Google Home speaker for spring 2026 and revealed a partnership with Walmart to launch affordable indoor cameras and doorbells under the “onn” brand. 
Notably, Google is prioritizing current device owners by rolling out Gemini features to devices with adequate processing power, using cloud APIs and the Matter smart home standard for broad compatibility. This ensures Gemini’s reach to over 800 million devices—including both Google and third-party products—while the company refines experiences before releasing new hardware.
Gemini enhances user interaction by enabling more conversational, contextually aware commands. Users can reference vague details—like a movie or song—and Gemini will intuit the correct response, such as playing music, explaining lyrics, or suggesting content. It can handle more complex household management tasks like creating shopping lists based on recipes, setting nuanced timers, and chaining multiple requests. 
Device naming is now simplified, and Gemini can manage routines, automate energy usage monitoring, and suggest home security setups via the new “Ask Home” feature. These improvements are facilitated by Google’s upgraded Home app, now more stable and powered by Gemini.
The app uses AI to summarize camera activity, describe detected events, and guide users with direct answers and recommendations, streamlining daily home routines. Gemini Live introduces continuous conversational interaction without the need to repeat “Hey Google,” promising a more natural AI experience. 
Google’s toolkit, reference hardware, and SDK support further empower partners and developers, reinforcing its market-wide AI ambitions. The Nest and Walmart devices are available now, while the new Home speaker is due spring 2026.
external.title: Google Launches Gemini AI Across Home and Nest Devices

record.text: How Reporting Spam Calls and Texts Helps Stop Scammers for Everyone #Applespamfilter #blockscamcalls #CyberFraud

external.description:
Almost everyone has experienced an unexpected call or text from an unknown number. While some turn out to be harmless misdials, many are actually spam or phishing attempts aimed at stealing personal or financial information. In some cases, the scam is obvious—like a caller asking for banking or credit card details—but other times, it’s much harder to tell.


To combat this, tech giants like Apple and Google allow users to mark suspicious calls or texts as spam or junk. Once flagged, your mobile carrier, the device manufacturer, third-party databases, and sometimes even federal bodies like the FCC and FTC, are notified.


On the network side, reported numbers are added to a centralized spam database. That’s why some calls appear on your screen labeled “Spam Likely.” It means that enough users have flagged the number, prompting your carrier to take preventive action. Essentially, every report you make contributes to a safer network for all users.


Modern carriers also use AI and machine learning to detect and block spam activity. For example, Google’s AI-based scam detection system becomes smarter and more accurate the more users report suspicious calls and messages.


Third-party apps like Truecaller, RoboKiller, and Hiya also rely on user reports to strengthen their own spam-blocking databases. This collective effort creates a ripple effect—when users flag spam, these systems improve their ability to identify and prevent future scams.


Unfortunately, scammers are evolving too. One of their most common tricks is “neighbor spoofing,” where they disguise their number to look like a local one. This creates a false sense of trust (“It’s a call from my area, it must be legitimate”). Fraudsters may even impersonate government bodies or organizations like the IRS or local police to extract personal data.


If you’re uncertain about the legitimacy of a call or text, the safest move is to hang up and contact the organization directly using verified contact details. Chances are, they’ll confirm it was a scam attempt.


To stay protected, you can also use your phone’s in-built spam filters:




 * 


For iPhone users: Go to Settings > Messages > Message Filtering > Unknown & Spam > Filter Unknown Senders. To block a number, tap the info icon next to it and select Block Contact, or long-press a spam text and block it directly.


 * 


For Android users: Open Google Messages > Settings > Spam Protection > Enable Spam Protection. To block, open Phone > More > Call history, choose the number, and tap Block/Report Spam. You can also block a number directly from your text messages by long-pressing the conversation.






Additionally, you can report spam directly to your mobile carrier by forwarding the suspicious message to 7726 (SPAM). If you believe you’ve encountered fraudulent activity, you can file a report with both the FTC and FCC for further investigation.


By consistently reporting spam, users help improve detection tools, reduce fraud, and make communication networks safer for everyone.

In some cases, the scam is obvious—like a caller asking for banking or credit card details—but other times, it’s much harder to tell.


To combat this, tech giants like Apple and Google allow users to mark suspicious calls or texts as spam or junk. Once flagged, your mobile carrier, the device manufacturer, third-party databases, and sometimes even federal bodies like the FCC and FTC, are notified.


On the network side, reported numbers are added to a centralized spam database. That’s why some calls appear on your screen labeled “Spam Likely.” It means that enough users have flagged the number, prompting your carrier to take preventive action. Essentially, every report you make contributes to a safer network for all users.


Modern carriers also use AI and machine learning to detect and block spam activity. For example, Google’s AI-based scam detection system becomes smarter and more accurate the more users report suspicious calls and messages.


Third-party apps like Truecaller, RoboKiller, and Hiya also rely on user reports to strengthen their own spam-blocking databases. This collective effort creates a ripple effect—when users flag spam, these systems improve their ability to identify and prevent future scams.


Unfortunately, scammers are evolving too. One of their most common tricks is “neighbor spoofing,” where they disguise their number to look like a local one. This creates a false sense of trust (“It’s a call from my area, it must be legitimate”). Fraudsters may even impersonate government bodies or organizations like the IRS or local police to extract personal data.


If you’re uncertain about the legitimacy of a call or text, the safest move is to hang up and contact the organization directly using verified contact details. Chances are, they’ll confirm it was a scam attempt.


To stay protected, you can also use your phone’s in-built spam filters:




 * 


For iPhone users: Go to Settings > Messages > Message Filtering > Unknown & Spam > Filter Unknown Senders. To block a number, tap the info icon next to it and select Block Contact, or long-press a spam text and block it directly.


 * 


For Android users: Open Google Messages > Settings > Spam Protection > Enable Spam Protection. To block, open Phone > More > Call history, choose the number, and tap Block/Report Spam. You can also block a number directly from your text messages by long-pressing the conversation.






Additionally, you can report spam directly to your mobile carrier by forwarding the suspicious message to 7726 (SPAM). If you believe you’ve encountered fraudulent activity, you can file a report with both the FTC and FCC for further investigation.


By consistently reporting spam, users help improve detection tools, reduce fraud, and make communication networks safer for everyone.
external.title: How Reporting Spam Calls and Texts Helps Stop Scammers for Everyone

external.description:
Have you ever felt like a stranger in your own life? Like you're playing a part, but you've forgotten your real lines? You're not alone. According to the legendary psychologist Carl Jung, most of us are living a lie.

Welcome to the podcast that guides you into the undiscovered country of your own mind. We're tearing down the "persona"—the social mask you've worn for so long you think it's your real face. But beneath that mask lurks your shadow self: the repressed, forbidden, and forgotten parts of you that hold the key to your greatest power and truest authenticity.

This isn't your typical self-help. This is depth psychology. We'll confront the powerful archetypes secretly running the script of your life and take on the ultimate illusion: the idea that your ego is even real to begin with. The journey of individuation—of becoming whole—requires you to face the parts of yourself you've been taught to hate. It’s the most terrifying and important work you will ever do.

If you're tired of playing a role and ready to finally meet the person you were always meant to be, subscribe now. Share this with anyone who is ready to begin their real life.

external.description:
What if I told you the entire tech industry as we know it is facing an extinction-level event? That every app, every software subscription, every line of code you use is about to become a fossil? According to Sam Altman, the CEO of OpenAI, that future isn't decades away. It's right around the corner.

Welcome to the definitive briefing on the race for Artificial General Intelligence (AGI). We're pulling back the curtain on Altman's radical vision: a world of unimaginable abundance where AI agents write custom software on demand, making the multi-trillion dollar SaaS economy obsolete and potentially ushering in an age of Universal Basic Income (UBI). It sounds like a utopia.

But while Altman preaches a golden age, his own top scientists are running for the exits. We'll explore the chilling warnings from the high-level executives who just resigned from OpenAI, claiming that the race for AGI is recklessly outpacing AI safety protocols and creating an existential risk for all of humanity.

Is Sam Altman building a paradise or a doomsday machine? Is this the dawn of a new human era or the twilight? This isn't a theoretical debate anymore. It's a battle for our future being fought right now.

Subscribe to understand the forces that are about to reshape our world. Share this with everyone you know—the stakes have never been higher.
external.title: CODE RED at OpenAI: The Race for AGI is Officially OUT OF CONTROL

external.description:
What happens when a top Harvard Professor looks at an object in our solar system and concludes it might be alien technology? This isn't science fiction. This is the reality of 3I Atlas, and Dr. Avi Loeb is sounding the alarm.

Welcome to the interview that could change everything. We sit down with Harvard's top astronomer, Avi Loeb, the man who isn't afraid to ask the biggest "what if" in all of science. He breaks down the chilling anomalies of the interstellar object 3I Atlas: how it flies like a cannonball when it should be tumbling, why it's shedding metals it shouldn't have, and its mind-bending trajectory from the same direction as the 1977 WOW Signal.

But this conversation goes beyond theory. Professor Loeb reveals his official call for the United Nations to prepare for First Contact, arguing that the discovery of extraterrestrial intelligence isn't a matter of if, but when. He explains why this single event could be the key to uniting humanity and launching a new golden age of space exploration.

This isn't just another UFO story. This is a Harvard-led investigation into a cosmic mystery that's unfolding right now.

Subscribe, share this episode immediately, and join the biggest conversation in human history. The search for answers starts now.

images.alt: Source The Guardian: "Francesca, 33, owns a digital marketing agency in Cardiff. Like Jamil, she explains that ChatGPT grants her access to a world of inferences and subtext that she’d otherwise find impossible to navigate. “As an autistic woman in an era where the only way to meet anyone is through dating apps, I have struggled immensely. I found understanding tone and ‘the rules’ impossible and so ChatGPT has been really useful,” she says. When she started using it in a dating context it was more as a digital sounding board – an impartial presence that could give her feedback on her profile and offer a debrief after a date."

Source The Guardian: "After that she found herself checking with the bot between every message, and requesting five variations before choosing the one that sounded most like her. “Over the course of a week, I realised I was relying on it quite a lot,” she says. “And I was like, you know what, that’s fine – why not outsource my love life to ChatGPT?""

Source The Guardian: "By the time they’d been on their third date, though, “I was using ChatGPT for our entire communication,” says Francesca. “I wasn’t even replying any more – he was basically just dating ChatGPT.” In person, their dates still lacked spark. “I was very aware that I’d taken it too far but I felt like I was in too deep by that point. I didn’t know how to get out of it, I didn’t know how to talk to this person as myself any more.”"

images.alt:
As 32-year-old Rich points out, though, "it's not like using ChatGPT guarantees success".
When he met someone in a bar one Friday night and swapped social media handles, he asked AI what his next move should be.
ChatGPT discerned that sending an initial message on Monday midmorning would set the right pace. "Then it gave me some options for what the message could be," says Rich.
"Keep it light, warm, and low-stakes so it reads as genuine interest without urgency," the bot advised. "Something like: Hey Sarah, still laughing about [tiny shared moment/reference if you've got one] - good to meet you!" Rich went back and forth with ChatGPT until he felt they'd hit upon exactly the right message ("Hey Sarah, it was lovely to meet you") but sadly she never replied, he says. "It's been two weeks now."

record.text: Orienter sa recherche, c’est LA partie qui donne de l’intérêt au travail. Je ne sous traiterai cette partie à aucun prix.

Et donc réduire les vrais échanges utiles (et zero carbone).
